title.title: BORIS
title.text:
It's Wednesday night. You had a lazy morning because you're unemployed. You decide to go see some art.

You call your friend. You arrive at the gallery.

On the door, a sign reads:

BORIS.

gallery_main.title: Gallery
gallery_main.text:
A white cube. Paintings and drawings on the walls. The sound of voices, glasses clinking. Someone laughs too loudly.

Your friend stands next to you.

work_01.title: sleeping girl and mutant dog
work_01.text: *you look at the floor plan, it says #4 - "Untitled(Orbit password)", oil on wood, 100 x 240 cm* damn, did where does the exhibition start? If its number 4 but its the first painting I saw... whatever..

work_01_detail.title: sleeping girl and mutant dog
work_01_detail.text: hm ok three wooden panels create cool separation of the image, but what else? I guess its also good for transporting the painting lol

friend_work_01.title: Your Friend
friend_work_01.text: "I don’t know… it’s weirdly nostalgic. I kind of like it, but also it makes me uncomfortable."

work_02.title: girl whispering into another girls ear
work_02.text: you are in front of an oil painting on wood 120x60 cm, it depicts a misty and thought provoking scene of one girl whispering something into another girls ear, you are deeply moved by the image

work_02_detail.title: Untitled (Floor Sculpture) — Close View
work_02_detail.text: You crouch down and notice small details: marks, scratches, odd angles. The sculpture feels both absurd and intimate up close.

friend_work_02.title: Your Friend
friend_work_02.text: "This one makes me laugh a bit… it’s like a classroom exploded in a good way."
